publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

history.provenance: found in Qizil Miŋ-Öyduring T III MQR 3

language.ana: frg:ls-cetom-archaic frg:ls-peyrot-A2 frg:ls-C14 frg:ls-malzahn-A5 frg:ls-C14 frg:ls-tamai-C1 frg:ls-C14

seg.seg: Er säte dort nahe bei dem Sitz des Alleswissenden die Wurzeln in die Erde.
There, close to the seat of the Omniscient, he sowed the roots into the earth.

p.note: In general, the script type is standard with only very few still archaic-shaped signs; cf. 265.

list.item: a1 illegible a2 [sa]ryat= om_p_a poyśintse asāṃ spe kenne witskaṃ _m_akci ka yo_p_a /// a3 stām\ 70-1 entwe _l_acä snai ke_ś_a _l_ak_utsetse _t_ar_k_a_r[s]e /// a4 mye[ṣ··] – k[ci]ya vairuḍiṣṣe [tā]y ore _t_a /// a5 [k]au[ṃ] (w)e[ṣ] y[ai] pudñäkte bram-ñäkte m_t_a pa[du](mne) /// a6 ·ñ· coksa sā_u 70-5 padum ram_t_a lalaupau krāke /// a7 [m]ā cämpyare cai _ś_amtsi k[r]aupeścä pudñäkt= entwe te we /// a8 – – [_p_a]l[ya]po māka p[k]āte [saṃ](sā)rmeṃ t[_s_a]l[p]as[ts]i [70] /// b1 – – – – – – – – mu[d]guly· /// b2 [_ṣ_a]ñ yamornta tasānte śamnā po ñäś cene ṅke cmema /// b3 s[t]= āk[ṣ]i _r_addhi kren_t\ 80-2 vidyäntse ceṃ ke_uc yan-ne _m_ant ra /// b4 – – k saw[o]ṃ _t_ar_k_ar ra praściye antpi _t_a /// b5 kte k_us(e) – – ñc· [p]u[dñ]ä[kt]e lo l(m)au śā_r_a pa /// b6 ṅ_k_arwa _m_an_t\ – lyśi _t_aṅwäññ[e] – – – – – /// b7 ṣṣentse ce_u preke takoy _k_antsa ka_l_p_anma _k_ante =kṣṇai sn[ai] /// b8 [l(·)]eṃ [·ä]llāṣṣa pudñäkteṣṣe _m_a[nt\] vi[ṣ··] – – ñ[ñ]e ///

a2 #M14# saryate|saryat= omp|ompä , poyśintse ; asāṃ spe , keṃne|kenne witsakaṃ|witskaṃ #70b makci|mäkci ka , yopar|yopä(r) /// %9 #71a %13 a3 stām 70-1 #71b entwe lac|läcä , snai keś|keśä ; läkutsetstse|läk_utsetse , tärkarmeṃ|tärkär{m}e«ṃ» (ramt) #72a /// %8 naumiyeṣṣa|(nau)|myeṣ(ṣa) a4 , (ñä)kciya #73a vairuḍiṣṣe , tāy ore ; tä /// %6 #73b %14 #74a (mant) a5 kauṃ (w)eṣ yai , pūdñäkte|pudñäkte ; bram-ñäkte ramt|mtä , padu(mne) #74b /// %14 #75a %10 a6 ·ñ· %1 , coksa sā_u 70-5 #75b padum ramt|ramtä , lalaupau ; krāke /// %5 #76a %14 #76b a7 mā cämpyāre|cämpyare , cai śamtsi|śämtsi ; kraupeśc|kraupeścä , pūdñäkte|pudñäkt= entwe #77a te we /// %12 #77b %12 a8 – – %2 #78a {o}lyapo , māka pkāte ; saṃ(sā)rmeṃ , tsalpästsi|tsälpastsi 70(-8) #78b /// b1 – – – – – – – – mudguly· /// #80b b2 ṣañ|ṣäñ , yāmornta|yamornta #81a tasānte , śāmna|śamnā po ñäś ; cene ṅke , cmema(r cmelne) #81b /// %14 #82a %9 b3 st= ākṣi , raddhi|räddhi krent 80-2 #82b vidyäntse ceṃ , kauc|ke_uc yaṃ-ne|yan-ne ; mänt ra /// %5 #83a %14 #83b %7 ; b4 %2 – – k sawoṃ , tarkär|tärkär ra #84a praściye , antapi|antpi tä /// %8 #84b %13 b5 kte #85a k_us(e) – – ñc· %3 , pūdñäkte|pudñäkte ; lo l(m)au śār|śārä , pa /// %2 #85b %14 #86a %4 , tsäṅkarwa|(tsä)|ṅkärwa b6 ; mänt – lyśi täṅkwaññe|täṅwäññe – – – – – /// #87b %1 śaiṣṣentse|(śai)|ṣṣentse b7 , cau|ce_u preke ; tākoy|takoy käntsa , kalpanma|kalpänma #88a kante|känte akṣnai|=kṣṇai , snai /// %10 #88b %12 śpālmeṃ|(śpā)|l(m)eṃ b8 #89a ·ällāṣṣa , pūdñäkteṣṣe|pudñäkteṣṣe ; mänt viṣ(nu) – – ññe /// #89b

Malzahnarchaic ~ standard
TamaiII-1 (600-700)

a2 Er säte dort nahe bei dem Sitz des Alleswissenden die Wurzeln in die Erde. 438

I changed a5 «ra»mtä to mtä because it violated the meter and mtä is perfectly fine. -Martin (Fri, 2020-03-20, 01:14)
In general, the script type is standard with only very few still archaic-shaped signs; cf. [[Malzahn 2007a]]: 265.
